result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis M. Lyons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may apply for an early discharge from probation after serving 2 years ifall conditions of probation have been satisfied. Including but not limited to payment of restitution and any treatment required by the agent. The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Restitution and costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections as required in felony convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evualations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with Randall Frane of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

Defendant may apply for expunction of this case upon reaching the age of 24 and having successfully completed probation. Additionally the defendant shall not have any further violation of criminal law.

timeConds.notes: Defendant granted huber priveleges and is to report for the sentence on or before 2-20-2015 at 7pm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis M. Lyons
